emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Contracts that automatically execute based on AI analysis of conditions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases efficiency, reduces fraud but raises concerns about AI decision-making accountability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legal acceptance, regulatory frameworks, trust in AI systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: Use of blockchain for coordination of space missions, resource sharing, and operations.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to democratized space exploration but might also complicate international space law.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: International cooperation, regulatory bodies for space activities, investment in space tech.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Energy trading where consumers can buy, sell, or trade energy tokens.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes energy independence and efficiency, potential grid stability issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Government support for green energy, consumer education, integration with existing energy systems.

emerging_technologies.name: DAO-governed Neural Networks
emerging_technologies.description: Neural networks where governance and updates are managed by a decentralized autonomous organization.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize how AI adapts to user needs but raises ethical questions about AI governance.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public trust in decentralized systems, regulatory frameworks, technological maturity.

mainstream_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
mainstream_technologies.description: Applications that allow for private computations and data transfers without revealing underlying data.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in sectors requiring high privacy like finance and healthcare.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Transport Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Systems where transport infrastructure and services are managed through blockchain for efficiency and fairness.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into urban planning, especially in smart cities.

epoch_themes.description: An era where decentralized systems govern various aspects of life from energy to space exploration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes autonomy, reduces centralized control, but challenges traditional governance models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased push for transparency, participation, and security in governance structures.

epoch_themes.description: Using technology to enhance sustainability efforts, particularly in energy and resource management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Aims at reducing environmental impact, promoting circular economy, but requires significant behavioral and infrastructural changes.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for zero emissions, renewable energy adoption, and sustainable urban development.
